conclusion: Calculate total displacement from the v-t graph to determine if the particle returns to the starting point.
0 to 1 second: Velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
Area under the curve from 0 to 1 second is 2 m.
1 to 2 seconds: Velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to 0 m/s.
Area under the curve from 1 to 2 seconds is 1 m.
2 to 3 seconds: Velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
Area under the curve from 2 to 3 seconds is -1 m.
Total displacement is 2 m + 1 m + (-1 m) = 2 m.
The particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
